thread.title: Local roundup: Stonington edges Waterford 1-0 in field hockey
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Stonington edges Waterford 1-0 in field hockey

author: Day Staff Reports
title: Local roundup: Stonington edges Waterford 1-0 in field hockey
text:
Already registered on theday.com? Login. 
Not registered on theday.com? Register . Close Local roundup: Stonington edges Waterford 1-0 in field hockey Waterford's Isabel Cavalieri (13), left, Stonington's Abby Flakus fight for control of the ball during the Bears' 1-0 ECC victory on Thursday at Waterford. (Dana Jensen/The Day) Published October 15. 2015 9:58PM Day Staff Reports 
Waterford — Margit Burgess scored an unassisted goal with 12 minutes, 40 minutes remaining to give unbeaten Stonington a 1-0 victory over Waterford on Thursday in an Eastern Connecticut Conference field hockey game. 
It was the fifth game in 10 days for the Bears (9-0-3, 9-0-2), who remain tied for first place in the conference with Killingly. 
"We'got got kids who are injured ... we've got kids who are tied," Stonington coach Jenna Tucchio said. "We were just happy to grind this one out and we're all looking forward to a day off." 
Karena Bushey made six saves in goal for Waterford (2-7-1, 2-7-1) while Stonington goalie Cameron Dreher did not face a shot. 
In other games: 
• Alexis Burgess scored three goals as East Lyme cruised to a 7-1 win over Windham in the ECC. Elena Hynes and Lauren Abbey added one goal and one assist for the Vikings (8-2-1, 7-2-1) while Cara Bradley and Amelia Selmeski each scored a goal and Rachael Silva and Anna Fennell each had an assist. 
Girls' soccer 
• Saige Morin scored three goals as Putnam defeated Norwich Tech/Holy Family 6-2 in the Constitution State Conference East. Emily Kivela scored both goals for NT/HF (6-5, 3-4) and goalie Lauren Veile made 12 saves. Putnam is 6-5, 5-0. 
H.S. volleyball 
• Ledyard outlasted Montville 3-2 in the ECC Medium Division by game scores of 19-25, 25-22, 25-19, 16-25 and 15-13. Chloe Hespeler had three service aces, eight kills and six blocks for the Colonels (2-13, 2-3), while Sela Gill had five aces and 15 assists. For Montville (6-9, 4-3), Olivia Fargo and five aces and 22 digs, Sarah Monahan had four kills and Hailey Edwards had 13 digs and three aces. 
Women's soccer 
• Lea Adams scored a goal with just 70 seconds remaining to give Salve Regina at 2-1 victory over Coast Guard Academy in Newport, R.I. Caroline Eastman, assisted by Taylor Peacer, scored her first goal of the season for the Bears (6-7) while freshman goalie Rachel Boohar made eight saves. 
• Sophomore Michelle Medina had one goal an assisted on another to highlight Connecticut College's 3-0 nonleague victory over Johnson & Wales in Providence. Alexa Tribelli and Libby Thomas added second half goals for the Camels (2-6-3) while Alex Santiago, a freshman from St. Bernard, made one save to earn her first collegiate shutout. Waterford's Cassidy Susi, left, and Stonington's Erin Craig battle for possession during Thursday's ECC game at Waterford. Stonington edged the Lancers 1-0. (Dana Jensen/The Day)
